name: Converge
slogan: Massively scaleable wireless sensors and analytics for industry
description:
Converge’s mission is to make Industry efficient, safe and sustainable by bringing data driven decision making to the worksite. We engineer reliable, massively scaleable and well designed hardware and software products that make it easy to deploy wireless sensor networks and analyse the physical data they produce. We are convincing the world’s largest, most traditional and risk-averse industrial companies to embrace IoT. 
 
Our immediate focus has been to help civil engineers on construction sites better monitor concrete strength. Over the last two years, Converge has deployed thousands of sensors across the UK, helping hundreds of engineers do their job more efficiently, and building deep insight and expertise in the construction industry by connecting the physical environment. Lagging construction productivity currently costs the global economy over $1.6 trillion every year. Our technology is already having a huge impact on some of the UK’s largest infrastructure projects.

jobs.title: Product Designer
jobs.description:
We are looking for a Product Designer to join our growing team. We are expanding our suite of products and are looking for someone to help us define and design the features that create value for our users. You will report into our Head of Design, with an opportunity to shape key products and features within our roadmap as we build the future.

**About the role**

As a Product Designer, you will be part of our product team, where your role will be to discover how our technology can support and completely redefine the construction process. This means: translating user needs into clear design concepts; creating flows, prototypes, and high-fidelity visuals for product features; collaborating closely with our engineers to ensure a high-quality implementation; and, ultimately, creating a magical product in concert with the rest of the team.

You will have responsibility and ownership over the design of simple and intuitive user experiences for new product features as we create the products to increase productivity and sustainability in the construction industry. You’ll work directly with our product team and development teams to ship features that enhance the value our products create for the business and our customers in a fast-paced, complex environment.

**Key Responsibilities**

You will:

- Apply your design thinking and execution skills throughout the entire product lifecycle.
- Own the solution process, create design concepts (wireframes, prototypes, information architecture), iterate quickly to validate.
- Communicate your work succinctly and effectively, aligning the outcome across different functions in the organisation.
- Conduct user research and customer interviews, organise and present the findings.
- Take a data-driven approach, running user testing and user research, looking for user behaviour patterns and provide valuable insights to the Product team.
- Run A/B and MVT tests, constantly auditing and revising our assumptions and previous designs.
- Produce wireframes, UX flows, low fidelity mock-ups, interactive prototypes, and high-fidelity visual design for the web and apps.
- Deliver beautiful final visuals and interaction designs.
- Participate in design team-wide initiatives (hiring, workshops, design system, improving design tools, team reviews, sharing, and brainstorms).

**About you**

You should have:

- 3yrs+ experience designing digital products and services, including user experience, interaction and user interface design), delivering solutions that have elevated customer and user experience. B2B experience is a bonus.
- Experience handling complexity, reducing complex problems down to valuable and efficient solutions.
- A general understanding of how design impacts development, along with a knack for constructing dynamic, interactive designs that are technically feasible.
- Experience in user research and usability testing best practice, specifically in regards to user-centred design.
- Experience in hypothesis-driven design, A/B testing, and defining quick and inexpensive ways of learning and iterating.
- Experience with Sketch, Figma, XD, and InVision.
- A portfolio that reflects your strengths in both UX and visual design skills (end-to-end product design).
- Mastery over your design process and methodology, with the desire and ability to help shape ours.
- (Bonus) A good understanding of the challenges of working on products that have both digital and physical elements.
- (Bonus) experience launching entire products at global scale.
- (Bonus) experience designing for B2B audiences with complex problems.

**Benefits**

Learn more about our team, benefits and perks on our [website](https://converge.io/about-us/)!

jobs.title: Head of Operations
jobs.descriptionHtml:
Head of Operations at Converge

London, UK

Converge is looking for a talented Head of Operations who has experience scaling hardware startups internationally. You must be someone who is excited by the opportunity of building the tools, systems, and processes to solve Converge's growth challenges, and will be responsible for building the operational backbone to enable rapid international expansion and product diversification. Over the next 18 months, our aim is to expand our presence to dozens of new territories and launch several new products, all alongside key partners which include some of the largest construction companies in the world.

About the role

As our Head of Operations, you will report directly to our CEO, Raph, building the foundational processes and operational engine which enables scale. You will be directly accountable for managing the operations team and be responsible for manufacturing, supply chain, fulfillment and logistics, order management, legal processes, and general-purpose processes that solve for scale.

Key Responsibilities

You will be responsible for our growing supply chain:

Sourcing new suppliers/CMs for electronics, PCBA, or packaging manufacturers;

Managing existing suppliers (relationship management & renewals / renegotiation);

Coordinate the flow of parts and materials across our suppliers, CMs and R&D lab;

Negotiate commercial terms and contracts with suppliers.

You will scale our manufacturing operation, which includes responsibility for:

Taking new hardware products to mass production;

Ensuring our hardware is certified for use in the relevant territories (CE, FCC etc…);

Optimising quality and production cost of products to improve service and margin;

Scaling and globalising production output, managing stock levels & cash flow;

Manage our hardware refurbishment process;

You will build on our logistics and fulfillment systems to support the international scale:

You will lead the continued implementation of our ERP system (Odoo);

You will manage our global network of logistics, fulfillment and delivery partners;

Lead the move from in-office to out-of-office, global order fulfillment;

You will ensure compliance with all international trade (import/export) regulations;

Accurately forecast demand in a high-growth, high-volatility environment

You will be responsible for building underlying processes critical to scale, including:

You will automate processes and integrate tools to create a consistent ops model;

You will build a process for order management and billing alongside Sales/Finance;

You will work with our CEO to improve our legal frameworks & processes;

You will be responsible for managing and developing the operations team (of three):

You will work closely with the CEO to set quarterly OKRs for the team;

You will need to provide leadership and manage the team’s biweekly sprints;

You will be responsible for producing regular KPIs, and quarterly board packs.

About you

Must have:

4-10 years experience in an operations role at a hardware technology company

You have launched and scaled at least one new technology product into the market;

You have integrated or configured an ERP system to support operations before;

You have experience with international trade laws (import/export)

You have spun up a manufacturing line (Europe or Asia) and overseen the production of a physical product end-to-end;

You have managed a logistics operation with third-party fulfillment partners;

You are a spreadsheet wizard;

You are comfortable with a systems-level thinking approach to problem-solving;

You have expertise in defining and scaling internal and external operational process;

Nice to have:

Experience writing software (python, javascript or similar) and automating/integrating systems;

Experience in data science (R, python or similar)

Experience manufacturing hardware in China

Benefits

Learn more about our team, benefits and perks on our website!

jobs.title: Senior Software Engineer
jobs.description:
### Senior Software Engineer

London, UK/Remote

 

We are looking for a senior software engineer who values code as a craft to help us build out our digital model of the construction industry, fed with real-time data.

 

At Converge you can be certain that you will work on a well-engineered codebase written by a team who cares. We value high-quality code but understand how important it is to get things done, rather than perfect.

 

We deeply value collaborative work. Careful code-reviews, well-written tests, and beautifully written code ensure that our customers will get an amazing product delivered, which is safe and delightful to use.  
  
We're a small, multicultural, and close bunch, which means that everyone can have a big impact on what we do, from how our platform looks, to how our sensors work.

 

Converge has already achieved a lot in more than 200 sites across the world, and we look forward to having you with us so that we can do even more and continue to scale globally.

About the role

You will be engaged in the rapid development of several new products in 2020 alone, with exposure to the existing portfolio too, helping to scale those products internationally.

### Key Responsibilities

- Develop and maintain our APIs and backend services
- Implement UIs and maintain our client-side applications, including a mobile app and a web platform
- Reviewing other team members' code
- Work closely with product and design teams to flesh out features and requirements
- Collaborate with the hardware team to bring amazing new products to life
- Monitor, troubleshoot, and provide support for our applications
- Automating repetitive tasks (let the machines do it!)
- Write thorough software tests: unitary, integration, and E2E.

**Requirements**

### You should have:

- At least 5 years of experience developing and shipping code professionally
- A solid understanding of JavaScript
- Excellent understanding and professional experience applying testing practices (TDD, Exploratory Testing, E2E tests)
- In-depth understanding of relational databases (preferably Postgres)
- Detailed understanding of how to use Git in a team setting
- Experience working in an environment that embraces a DevOps culture
- Experience with agile methodologies
 

It would be nice if you have:

- Previous experience in the IoT sector
- Mobile development experience
- Experience building data processing pipelines for time-series data  
 

### Our Stack

- Node.js, Typescript, React, Redux, Postgres, Python, RabbitMQ, React Native, Docker, Ansible, DigitalOcean, AWS.

**Benefits**

Learn more about our team, benefits and perks on our [website](https://converge.io/about-us/)!

jobs.title: VP Commercial
jobs.description:
### VP Commercial at Converge

London, UK.   
We are looking for someone who is mission-oriented, intrinsically motivated, and an experienced commercial operator to join us as VP Commercial to help us flourish as we expand internationally, as well as nurturing and deepening the strong commercial relationships we have with some of the biggest and most innovative construction companies on the planet.

###   

### About the role

You will be based in our London office and reporting directly to Raph, our CEO. You will be leading and managing our UK and International sales teams, as well as shaping our commercial strategy. You will also be deeply involved in nurturing the strong relationships we have formed with some of the world’s biggest and most innovative construction companies who form a key part of our future success.

### Key Responsibilities

- Leading and expanding the UK and International sales teams, including mentoring those under you and developing the systems and procedures that will ensure our success.
- Forming UK and International expansion strategy as we expand globally (we currently sell into the UK, Hong Kong, Singapore, and are starting to sell into Germany and Australia).
- Working alongside Raph, our CEO, to shape our commercial strategy as it relates to:
  - the three new products we are releasing in 2020/21;
  - our enterprise SaaS offerings for some of our largest customers.
 
- Nurturing and deepening the relationships we have built with some of the biggest and most innovative construction companies in the world, as well as originating new relationships and partnerships.
- Informing key strategic decisions for the future of the company, and working with the leadership team to implement them.
- Working with the product teams to ensure that we leverage our relationships to build the products which will transform the construction industry and satisfy the company’s mission.
- Negotiating all commercial deals (as directed by the CEO), including overseeing the legal documents for final approval by the CEO.
- Interacting with stakeholders from site engineers to technical directors to group CEOs (don’t worry, we’ll provide wellies).

**Requirements**

### Must have:

- SaaS sales experience
- Owned and developed commercial function
- Experience managing a UK sales team
- Built relationships with channel partners and developed partnerships internationally
- Own and grown a number with year on year growth

### Nice to have:

- Worked in a startup environment or experience scaling a commercial team
- Construction or technical background

**Benefits**

Learn more about our team, benefits and perks on our [website](https://converge.io/about-us/)!

jobs.description:
### APAC Lead at Converge

Singapore

We are looking for someone who is mission-oriented, intrinsically motivated, and an experienced commercial operator to join us as APAC Lead to help us flourish as we expand internationally, as well as nurturing and deepening the strong commercial relationships we have with some of the biggest and most innovative construction companies on the planet.

### About the role

You will be based remotely in Singapore reporting to our leadership team based out of London, UK. You will be managing our APAC sales operations and strategy. You will also be deeply involved in nurturing the strong relationships we have formed with some of the world’s biggest and most innovative construction companies who form a key part of our future success.

### What success looks like in the first 3-6 months:  
 

1. Closed first deal
2. Completed market research on 2 APAC regions with recommendations on next steps for expansion
3. Have built a pipeline of 3 pilots for future products

### Key Responsibilities  
 

- Market research and assist with develop ing APAC expansion strategy as we expand globally (we currently sell into the UK, Hong Kong, Singapore, and are starting to sell into Germany and Australia).
- Working alongside our VP Commercial and International Sales Lead, to shape our commercial strategy as it relates to:
  - the three new products we are releasing in 2020/21;
  - our enterprise SaaS offerings for some of our largest customers.
 
- Nurturing and deepening the relationships we have built with some of the biggest and most innovative construction companies in the world within APAC region, as well as new business development. 
- Day to day operational and support duties for active sites in the region. 
- Interacting with stakeholders from site engineers to technical directors to group CEOs (don’t worry, we’ll provide wellies).

### Must have:  
 

- 3-4 years client facing experience in B2B sales or consulting 
- Proficient in English
- Ability to travel extensively, expect ~30% travel time
- Account management experience with key clients
- Business strategy (e.g advisory responsibilities to board) 

### Nice to have:

- Proficiency in a South East Asian Language 
- Experience in the Construction or Civil Engineering Sectors
- Proven success in remote/independent working 
- Startup technology experience
